result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J Adam was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: with criminal case settlement & JI's

Case called at 2:38pm [mo]
Defendant Nicholas J Adam in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

 Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "No Contest" entered on charge in Information; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Adam  guilty of the charge in the Information, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel 
Statement made by Mr. Adam

The Court sentences Mr. Adam   to  3  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  years &   0 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2  years &  0  months. Consecutive to any other sentence in being.

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 

The Court gives   0  days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling or therapy as required by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--to obtain employment and/or education program per Agent
--no possession of controlled substance without a valid prescription
--no use of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession or consumption of alcohol 
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 3:06pm

Pre-trial conference at 06-10-2015 09:00 am
Scheduling notice

Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV: 
[MK] case called at 8:37am. 
Defendant Nicholas J Adam in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Adam waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" entered
recess 8:41am.

Preliminary hearing on May 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Probable Cause Statement
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 1:53pm.  Clerk - CRHI.  
Defendant Nicholas J. Adam in court via video with Attorney Yelena Zarwell from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office.  PD will appoint counsel.  Defendant in custody. Public Service Special Prosecutor Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon agree of the parties, the Court fines the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient.

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing on 5/11/15 at 9am.  Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by the defense to the time and date scheduled for Prelim. Hrg. 
The Court requires a $250.00 CASH Bond, with conditions: 
--  No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
--  No possession of drug paraphernalia including needles unless for a documented medical purpose.

Recess 1:59pm

NEXT:   (Notices to be mailed.)
Preliminary Hrg - 5/11/15 at 9am
